data: cut down on the right side at some point prior to discovery.
Found during the excavation of foundations for a new building on the north side of via Eumelo, at the Corso Gelone end of the street .
Currently not located in the museum, and apparently last seen for study by Manganaro c.1962, when the stele was photographed.

Neg. 14373B, Archivio della Sopritindenza di Siracusa: Propriètà della Regione Siciliana, Assessorato dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana – Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana – Soprintendenza per i Beni Culturali e Ambientali di Siracusa.

Neg. 8880B, Archivio della Sopritindenza di Siracusa: Propriètà della Regione Siciliana, Assessorato dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana – Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana – Soprintendenza per i Beni Culturali e Ambientali di Siracusa.

An outstanding collection of archaeological material. The collection ranges from Siracusa and the surrounding territory (Megara Hyblaia, Akrai, Kasmenai etc) to encompass all of eastern Sicily, reaching as far as Gela and Agrigento. The ground floor covers prehistory through to the end of the Classical period. Upstairs includes Hellenistic and Roman Syracuse and a display of material from the catacombs. A gallery displaying material from Hellenistic eastern Sicily is in preparation.
Association pour l’encouragement des études greques, « Bulletin épigraphique », Revue des études grecques, 1888, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/797735566
G.V. Gentili, «Nuovi elementi di epigrafia siracusana», Archivio Storico Siracusano 7 (1961): 5–25
Giacomo Manganaro, «Nuove ricerche di epigrafia siceliota», Siculorum Gymnasium 16 (1963): 51–64
Luigi Moretti, «I technitai di Siracusa», Rivista di Filologia e di Istruzione Classica 91, fasc. 1 (1963): 38–45
Die Vereine der dionysischen Techniten im Kontext der hellenistischen Gesellschaft: Untersuchungen zur Geschichte, Organisation und Wirkung der hellenistischen Technitenvereine

S. Aneziri, Die Vereine der dionysischen Techniten im Kontext der hellenistischen Gesellschaft: Untersuchungen zur Geschichte, Organisation und Wirkung der hellenistischen Technitenvereine (Stuttgart: F. Steiner, 2003)
Venus Felix a Siracusa? Per una rilettura dei decreti della synodos di technitai di Afrodite Hilara
Alessia Dimartino, «Venus Felix a Siracusa? Per una rilettura dei decreti della synodos di technitai di Afrodite Hilara», Epigraphica 72 (2010): 21–49
The association of artists of Aphrodite Hilara: two decrees as evidence for an association of mime-artists in Syracuse
Ariadne Pagoni, ‘The Association of Artists of Aphrodite Hilara: Two Decrees as Evidence for an Association of Mime-Artists in Syracuse’, Zeitschrift Für Papyrologie Und Epigrafik 228 (2023): 171–80
Gentili, 1961, Nuovi elementi di epigrafia siracusana
Manganaro, 1963, Nuove ricerche di epigrafia siceliota
Aneziri, 2003, Die Vereine der dionysischen Techniten im Kontext der hellenistischen Gesellschaft: Untersuchungen zur Geschichte, Organisation und Wirkung der hellenistischen Technitenvereine
Dimartino, 2010, Venus Felix a Siracusa? Per una rilettura dei decreti della synodos di technitai di Afrodite Hilara
Pagoni, 2023, The association of artists of Aphrodite Hilara: two decrees as evidence for an association of mime-artists in Syracuse

cut down on the right side at some point prior to discovery.

limestone stele 112 15.3-16.5 7 chiselled Line 1 Interlineation line 1 to 2 Syracusae Siracusa 37.08415, 15.27628 In honour of procos. 46/45 BCE Found during the excavation of foundations for a new building on the north side of via Eumelo, at the Corso Gelone end of the street 37.0711123,15.2834059. Currently not located in the museum, and apparently last seen for study by Manganaro c.1962, when the stele was photographed. None

ὑπὲρ προ ξενίας εὐεργεσία ς Μαάρκῳ Ἀκιλίῳ Μαάρκου υἱῷ Κανίνῳ ἀνθυπάτῳ Ῥωμαίῳ ἐπὶ ἱερέων Ἀθ Ἀριστοδήμου Κα ωνος εἰς βουλήν τῶν ἀρχόντων Μάαρκος Ἀκίλιος Μαάρκου Κάνινος ἀνθύπατος Ῥώμαιος πρὸς τοὺς θεοὺς καὶ πρὸς τὴν ἠμέτεραν πόλιν ἔχων τυγχάνει πρόξ ενον καὶ εὐεγ έταν ων περὶ τὴν ἱλαρὰν Ἀ φροδίτην τεχνιτεύ οντας ἀναγραφθέντα στήλην καὶ ἀνάθημα ὄπως ἄπασι φανερὸν ᾖ ἐπιμελέτας καταγράψαι περὶ τοῖς εὐεργε τουμένοις.
